European Aeronautic Defence and Space Company (EADS) Formed (2000)

EADS is one of the world's largest aerospace companies. It was formed in 2000 from the merger of Aerospatiale Matra of France, DaimlerChrysler Aerospace of Germany, and Construcciones Aeronáuticas S.A. of Spain. Responsible for the final assembly of Airbus aircraft, it is one of the top makers of commercial and military aircraft. It is also one of the major arms manufacturers in Europe, and its divisions also produce communications systems, space rockets, and satellites. Where is it based? More...

Rank: Advanced Member

Joined: 2/4/2014

Posts: 13,205

Neurons: 14,497,664

Location: Bogotá, Bogota D.C., Colombia

**EADS** (European Aeronautic Defence and Space Company) has its headquarters in **Paris, France**, and **Munich, Germany**⁵. However, the North American activities of Airbus, which was part of EADS, are represented by **Airbus Group, Inc.** (formerly EADS North America). This American arm of the company is headquartered in **Herndon, Virginia**, and participates in U.S. Department of Defense programs as a prime contractor⁶. Additionally, there's an organization called the **Eastern Air Defense Sector (EADS)**, which is a joint bi-national military organization located in **Rome, New York**³.

Source: Conversation with Copilot, 10/07/2024
